metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8540 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer underflow in the png_check_keyword function in pngwutil.c in libpng 0.90 through 0.99, 1.0.x before 1.0.66, 1.1.x and 1.2.x before 1.2.56, 1.3.x and 1.4.x before 1.4.19, and 1.5.x before 1.5.26 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a space character as a keyword in a PNG image, which triggers an out-of-bounds read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8540` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpng12-0 - 1.2.50-1ubuntu2.14.04.2
libpng3 - 1.2.50-1ubuntu2.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libpng package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.50-1ubuntu2.14.04.2').
